node.title: The secret to Succession's success lies in taking a huge risk
node.description: In a time that seems to crave the sweetness of a Ted Lasso, it's brave to make a TV show doused in so much vinegar, where absolutely everyone is perfectly dreadful, writes Virginia Trioli.
node.content:
["Roman Roy is ebullient. He's so filled with the power of his own success that he's waved his long-suffering chauffer away and is actually\u00a0walking down a street\u00a0\u2013 one where his unmarked loafers would never usually be allowed to step.", "In a recent episode of the celebrated TV series,\u00a0Succession, Roman, effortlessly played by Kieran Culkin, calls his dad, his restless and monstrous shark of a father, to boast of a business deal \u2014 a triumph to trump his siblings. \"I'm the only kid you'll ever need,\" he coos. \"You can kill the others.\"", "Brian Cox, the classically trained actor who lifts the titanic figure of Logan Roy into heights of Shakespearean power, has played King Lear before. His performance at the Royal National Theatre in 1990 is\u00a0considered a masterpiece, redefining the way this pitiless father will forever be seen.", "Cox has said no matter who he plays he never judges, he always remembers that his character \u2014 father, despot, murderer \u2014 was a human being: \"You're always looking for the humanity.\"", "In a time that seems to crave the Chantilly cream of a Ted Lasso, it's brave to make a TV show doused in so much vinegar, where absolutely everyone is perfectly dreadful.", "", "
Australian actor Sarah Snook on why we're obsessed with Succession
", "It's crazy brave to make one where the parents \u2014 biological, step, divorced all of them \u2014 are even worse. Even Moira Rose in Schitt's Creek had to be written with redeeming charm and vulnerability: nobody could take a mother who was\u00a0that\u00a0narcissistic. The Roy's breathtakingly unkind mother, Caroline Collingwood \u2014 played by the great Harriet Walter \u2014 walks uncharted territory in the character of a mother who seems to play vicious attacks on her own daughter as dinner party banter.", "", "
Catherine O'Hara as the narcissistic Moira Rose in Schitt's Creek.(AP)
", "Sex and the City may have launched its own courageous TV moment with its cringy reboot And Just Like That, and whereas once a favourite Noughties parlour game was \"which one of the girls are you?\" (why everyone wanted to be Carrie \u2014 a sex columnist who only ever had sex in the missionary position with her bra on \u2014 beats me). Now the better game is: which Roy do you think you'd be?", "I love tracking the evolving representation of the family in television shows that become cultural touchstones: the brittle sniping of the 1970s' All in the Family eventually becomes Everybody Loves Raymond \u2014 the kind of show where you genuinely wonder why any of these awful people spend time together. At least the Roys are interested in each other.", "The contemporary representation of privileged, upper middle-class dalliance in The Affair is brilliantly brutal in its depiction of how careless a couple can be with each other's feelings.", "But whether it's Roseanne or Married with Children, one Rubicon it seems must not be crossed: functional or not, inarticulate or not, the parent's love for the child must be absolute.", "I think that's why I enjoy Succession as much as I do: it's a luscious and thrilling place from which I can enjoy \u2014 at a safe distance \u2014 one of literature's most dangerous propositions: not the serpent's tooth of the thankless child, but the loveless parent.", "This Monday is the season finale, and I recommend it to you: I have high hopes for\u00a0a bonfire of the vanities\u00a0that will be seen from the moon. Then I'll await the gentle joy of a different kind of story, one of the family you make:\u00a0a new season of the Mandalorian. This is the way.", "If you're not watching TV this weekend then you can read about scammers, introverts and Robin Hood's home town. In no particular order.", "Have a safe and happy weekend celebrating\u00a0Kylie's admission to Music Victoria's Hall of Fame\u00a0\u2013 what took you guys so long!", "She's been in the ARIA Hall of Fame for a decade; even\u00a0Kylie's gold hotpants\u00a0were inducted ahead of her!", "She wears them with style\u00a0right here\u00a0\u2014 enjoy, and go well.", "Virginia Trioli is presenter on Mornings on\u00a0ABC Radio\u00a0Melbourne and the former co-host of\u00a0ABC\u00a0News Breakfast."]
